intro: Pimelea, commonly known as the mistletoe of the genus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Thymelaeaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Pimelea species are typically shrubs with small, often aromatic leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. They are known for their ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and are adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Some species are used in traditional medicine, while others are valued for their ornamental qualities.
